page.title: 01LANDSCAPE, TORRINGTONS LINCS
page.content: The area lies east of Lincoln, in the clay vale west of the{Lincolnshire {Wolds.}The land rises gently towards the east, but the scenery is generally unremarkable. Several small becks drain south-westward towards the{River {Witham,}their shallow valleys causing the minor undulations in the land- scape. There is little woodland. Most of the countryside is devoted to arable farming, though there are still many hedges between fields. Population is sparse and scattered. The hamlets of{East Torrington, Collow and{Bleasby Moor}are included in Legsby civil parish. The larger hamlet of{West Torrington}lies within this block, and parts of the parishes of Lissington, Holton Beckering and East Barkwith are also included.
